work.name: Center for Mathematical Modeling (CMM)
work.summary: I developed a PyTorch library for computing the Bayesian Wasserstein barycenter using the Stochastic Gradient Descent Algorithm in the Wasserstein space.
highlights: Implemented Wasserstein Generative Adversarial Networks (WGAN) to compute their barycenter and use it as a proxy for manifold projection.
Extended WGAN algorithms by incorporating an Autoencoder (AE) structure through the Wasserstein distance.
Approximated the posterior distribution using a GAN and the Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithm.
Developed a library for obtaining and processing the Quick, Draw! dataset.
